      <script type="text/javascript">
       var producttitle = 'Epiphone Emily The Strange G-310';

        function swapHero(heronum) {
            $('#ctl00_plcMain_HeroGallery_CurrentFinish').html($('#finishname_' + heronum).html());
            $('.hero').hide();
            $('.Hero' + heronum).show();

            var newimg = $('.Hero' + heronum).find('img.heroimg').attr('src');

            $('.hero-panel').find('.extra').hide();
            $('.Hero' + heronum).find('.extra').show();

            //replace pinterest image url on hero swap
            var url = $("#Pinterest-Pinit").find("a").attr("href");
            var results = (new RegExp("[\\?&amp;]media=([^&amp;#]*)")).exec(url);
            if (results != null) {
                var oldimg = results[1];
                url = url.replace(oldimg, newimg);
                $("#Pinterest-Pinit").find("a").attr("href", url);
            }
        }
      </script>

      <div class="feature-wrapper row">
       <div class="FeatureArea" id="Feature0">
        <div class="MainCopy">
         <div class="ProductSubtitle">
          Emily The Strange G-310
         </div>
         <div class="RomanceCopy">
          The Emily the Strange internet character created by the Cosmic Debris Company has become a worldwide phenomenon. And now, weve teamed up their striking graphics with one of our classic designs to make the Emily the Strange G-310. Since Epiphone introduced the G-310 over 15 years ago, it has been the go-to instrument for those wanting real SG tone and styling at an economical price. Every serious player wants an SG, and here's a real one that sounds as good as it looks. The original SG not only rivaled guitars of its own era for sonic variety, but also proved to be a sign of things to come. Hard rock, metal, and scores of rockers embraced the original SG and made it a classic. The Emily the Strange G-310 gives you the sound and look of a real SG with a one-of-a-kind 60s style finish but without the vintage price tag.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          And like all Epiphones, the Emily the Strange G-310 includes our Limited Lifetime Warranty and Gibsons famous 24/7/365 customer service. Visit your authorized Epiphone dealer today and break out today with a G-310.
          <div class="HeroRomance-Headline-Inner">
           The SG Story
          </div>
          When the SG or "Solid Guitar" was introduced in 1961 as a replacement for the Les Paul, it was called the "fretless wonder" for its low frets and fast action. The twin horn cutaway design was like nothing on the market and its light but balanced weight made it the perfect guitar for stage and studio. Later 60s models introduced the SG with humbucker pickups, and since then, the SG has gone on to become the go-to guitar for artists like The Who's Pete Townshend, Eric Clapton, Tony Iommi, Paul Weller, AC/DC's Angus Young, and Derek Trucks of the Allman Brothers Band.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="SpecsColumn">
         <div class="SpecsTable">
          <span class="SpecGroup-Title">
           SPECIFICATIONS
          </span>

       <div class="FeatureArea" id="Feature1" style="display:none;">
        <div class="FeatureCopy">
         <div class="FeatureHeadline">
         </div>
         <div class="FeatureRomance">
          The Emily the Strange G-310 uses the same dimensions and build techniques as vintage SGs made in Kalamazoo factory in the '60s.  The '67 style solid tone rich mahogany carved body gives the guitar a balanced feel on stage and in the studio (unlike cheap imitations that tend to be neck-heavy).  The SlimTaper D profile mahogany neck has 24.75 scale with 22 frets and a 12 radius for incredible reach thanks to the SGs classic cutaway.  And for that one-of-a-kind SG feel, the Emily the Strange G-310 has a rosewood fingerboard with a 1.68 nut, pearloid dot inlays, and Emilys iconic graphics on the headstock.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="FeatureImage">
         <img alt="" src="http://images.epiphone.com.s3.amazonaws.com/Products/SG/Emily-The-Strange/Features/Body.jpg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="FeatureArea" id="Feature2" style="display:none;">
        <div class="FeatureCopy">
         <div class="FeatureHeadline">
         </div>
         <div class="FeatureRomance">
          Epiphone always finds a way to make subtle but important improvements on our classic designs and the Emily the Strange G-310 is no exception. Emilys G-310s power comes from our special red- hot open-coil humbuckers with Alnico magnets featuring a 650R humbucker in the neck position and a 700T humbucker in the bridge position for killer classic tone with modern punch.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="FeatureImage">
         <img alt="" src="http://images.epiphone.com.s3.amazonaws.com/Products/SG/Emily-The-Strange/Features/Controls.jpg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="FeatureArea" id="Feature3" style="display:none;">
        <div class="FeatureCopy">
         <div class="FeatureHeadline">
          Epiphone Hardware You Can Trust
         </div>
         <div class="FeatureRomance">
          Epiphone leads the way in manufacturing in making great sounding guitars for players of all levels and that goes for our great hardware, too. Epiphone provides quality all-metal hardware on all its instruments including full function volume and tone knobs using full-size 500K O potentiometers matched with Epiphones rugged all-metal 3-way toggle pickup selector switch for long-lasting performance.
          <br/>
          <br/>
          The Emily the Strange G-310 features our LockTone Tune-O-Matic bridge and Stopbar tailpiece which yields incredible sustain and premium die-cast tuners for lifetime security.
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="FeatureImage">
         <img alt="" src="http://images.epiphone.com.s3.amazonaws.com/Products/SG/Emily-The-Strange/Features/Head.jpg"/>
        </div>
       </div>
